text: It's an early Friday morning and a patrol car drives up a unpaved road and parks next to a gutted police car on cin blocks. The camera pans with the OFFICER as he exits his and walks up to a ramp leading to the baby blue JAIL HOUS He is carrying a greasy bag of fast food.

The Officer enters the lobby, tosses the bag of food to h PARTNER who is sitting at a desk. He grabs a tin cup and  walks over to barred entrance to Block A. Twenty or so  CRIMINALS, from drunks to drug dealers are sleeping peace in their cell on Block A. The Officer rattles the tin cup between the entrance bar.

The inmates stir, rubbing their dirty faces and trying to sit up. The camera dollies slowly down the narrow hallway the block which has three cells: Two small ones side by s and one bigger cell that faces the block entrance. The so of scribbling and business dealing can be heard from insi the cell. It is AZUL jotting into a business ledger while chatting on his cellular phone. His cell is equipped with small desk and a refrigerator. He hangs up the phone and  continues writing.
The Officer with the tin cup sits in a couch across from partner, who is now eating, and reads a magazine.
Azul picks up his phone and makes another call. He talks  business. In the other cell, prisoners are getting up and looking around. Azul hangs up the phone and writes.

A gorgeous, bikini-clad BABE struts slowly into a tightly framed glamour shot. She pauses, takes a deep breath, the dives a 'perfect ten' dive into a house-side moat. She sw long, slow motion strokes around the moat as the camera t alongside her, lovingly admiring her tan lines and  hydrodynamic build. She slides out of the water and walks a cobble stone walk, dripping as she passes a seated GENT in a white suit. His face is unrevealed. As she enters th house, he sets his drink down by a phone. He lifts up the receiver and dials.

Azul's phone rings. He looks up at it, startled, as if no one has ever called him before. He glances at his watch, then back at the phone, hesitating to answer it. He looks around the cell block as if someone might be playing a tr on him. Finally he answers it, pausing before saying hell It is El Moco.
Good morning, Azul. Do you know who  this is?
(into phone) Moco... What the hell do you want  after all these years?
MOCO is sitting on his porch drinking tequila.
(into phone) We've got a lot to talk about. I'm  just a few town away with a whole  new gang. I heard you were nearby so  I thought I'd give you a call, amigo.
That's sweet of you, asshole. I don't  suppose you could get me out of there,  and then maybe hand me over my share  of money.

(into phone) Yes, I figured you'd want your money,  my friend. That is why I have called  you. I heard you were getting out  soon, and figured I should deal with  our situation. But do you really  need me to help you get out? From  what I hear, you're running quite a  business out of your cell with a  phone and some loyal men. It keeps  you well protected I hear. Not a bad  idea. I may try that myself sometime.
I could stay in here and earn peanuts  compared to what you owe me if I  were to get out. So, yes, I want you  to help me... my friend.
(into phone) Soon my friend, soon. I'm sending  you some people in a few days to get  you.
Really? Well, that's more like it.  Just like the Moco I used to know.
Azul is walking towards his window at the sound of a truc racing in.
(into phone) Just hang in there my friend. I won't  forget that you have been a big part  of our success. What's wrong.
A large truck drives up to the jail, parking beside the p car. Two tall, well-dressed MEN step out. They reach into the cab and pull out machine guns. They walk briskly towa the jail.
Azul walks to his toilet and stands on it to see out his  barred window.
(into phone) There's something going on outside.  Is this a double surprise? Are you  getting me out today, Moco?
There is no response from Moco.
The Guard reading the magazine stands when he sees someon approaching the door.
Close tracking shot of guns as Tall Men open the door and enter the jail.
Azul looks out of the jail cell suspiciously. Peering dow the hall, he sees the guys with the guns. He hides behind the wall, peering out to see what happens next.
The Tall Men walk right up to the guard, and hand him a h wad of money. The Guard tosses the money to his partner ( eating), then turns to unlock the block entrance bars.
Azul puts the receiver back up to his mouth.
(into phone) There are two men here with guns.  Did you send them?
Moco, glancing at his watch, hangs up.
Azul hangs up the phone and kicks his Bodyguard awake. Th Bodyguard gets up and peers out the bars as Azul hides in corner.

The Tall Men walk steady and alert, ready to kill. They e Azul's block and scope out the cells. The Bodyguard, seeing the tall men, retrieves his shotgun from under his mattress and grabs his machete from under sink. He stands ready to fight. The Tall Men move slowly towards the big cell, somewhat  cautious. They see the Bodyguard a second too late, for h sticks the shotgun between the bars, and shoots one of th before they can react. The shot one stumbles back into hi buddy's arms. Azul's Bodyguard, amused by all this, opens his cell door effortlessly, and walks out as if to greet  them. The Tall Men hear the sound of the other cells open so they turn around. The other prisoners on the block beg exiting their cells, carrying guns and Molotov cocktails. The Tall Man drops his gun. Finally, Azul exits his cell  carrying his phone. The Bodyguard forces the Tall Men int an empty cell, closing and locking the door. Azul presses the #-button on his phone. Moco's phone numb is automatically redialed. Moco answers.

(into phone) I'm still here, Moco. And so are  your little friends. But not for  long. They have something they want  to scream to you. Listen close,  because you're going to repeat it to  me when I come to visit you.
The cellmates throw their Molotov cocktails into the cell Moco hears the men screaming as they burn to death. Azul holding the phone at arm's length into the cell.

The Guards exchange glances when they hear the screaming, they smile and shrug, then go back to what they were doin As Azul and his Bodyguards exit the block, the Guard with the magazine stands up as if to stop them, but Azul tosse him a wad of money and the guard sits back down to count

A blue truck races towards the jail. Azul exits the jail carrying a shotgun. His Bodyguards ge inside the Tall Men's truck and start it. Azul waits pati for his blue truck. As the blue truck pulls up, two little rat-like VATOS exi the blue truck, one handing Azul a guitar case. Azul toss it onto the hood. The Bodyguards wave as they drive away. Azul waves back. He opens the case, revealing an arsenal weaponry. Azul notices one piece is missing. One Rat quic pulls the missing weapon from his jacket and replaces it the case. Azul is unamused. He grabs his MAC-10 machine g from the guitar case and aims it at the thieving Rat's he Suddenly, the Guard bolts out the jail waving the wad of  money, as if complaining. Azul turns his MAC-10 onto the Guard instead. A few blast later Azul and his rats pack up and go as the Guard twitc helplessly on the ground, still clutching the money in hi bloody hand.

The blue truck barrels down the highway and the camera pa with the truck as it passes a hitchhiker, MARIACHI, stand in the sun with a thumb in the air. The truck passes him so he continues walking. Mariachi is carrying a guitar ca in one hand and a black jacket in the other. He is wearin white T-shirt, black pants. The camera pans to a sign tha reads "ACU?A 18 miles".

Mariachi is walking around downtown Acu?a. He notices a b across the street and, liking the way it looks, he puts o his jacket and crosses over to it. He stops to read a sig on the building that says "MEMBERS AND NON-MEMBERS ONLY". prays silently to himself before confidently walking insi

Mariachi enters the club, greeting the PATRONS as he make his way to the bar. No one seems to greet him back. He si on a barstool near some OTHER DRINKERS, laying his guitar case down lovingly beneath his stool. He looks around the place, as if sizing it up.
What do you want to drink?
Refresco.

The other drinkers stare at him. Glancing around the room, Mariachi notices a small, table shaped object draped with a cloth in one corner of the ro Sitting directly behind him are four mean-looking dudes.  Mariachi is served his drink.
No hay musica?
(cleaning a glass) Why?
I'm a mariachi. A good one. I play  beautiful ballads, old classic  ballads, on an old-fashioned guitar.
So what?
I could add a little class to this  place. I work for fairly cheap, I  live mostly off tips. But I need  steady work, and I can guarantee  bringing in more customers.
(nodding) Tell me, why would I need one little  guitar player when I've already got  a full band?

Mariachi gives him a silent "what" look. The BARTENDER motions to a YOUNG MAN sitting near the sma draped table. The Young Man removes the drape revealing a keyboard. Put on his mariachi hat, dips his fingers into his shot glass and rubs his fingers together (as if warming up for the b show). He hits a few switches in EXTREME CLOSEUP as... ...Mariachi adjusts himself to the seat. The Young Men gently taps one switch and the keyboard sou like an accordion, pulsing out a beat. He then presses an switch and a horn section swells to a crescendo and waltz the familiar riffs. He adds the string and horns accents banging on the keys. He sounds awful. Mariachi grimaces slightly then turns back to the Bartend who seems to enjoy it. The Keyboard Mariachi finishes his song, sits back down.
(nodding with  satisfaction) There you see? Either I can pay one  guy to sound like a full mariachi  band...
Mariachi picks up his guitar and lays some money next to full drink. He looks disappointed.
...or I could spend the same money  only get one little guitar player...  Understand?
(walking away) Thank you, sir.
You want to earn a living? Get a  real musical instrument.

The Bartender picks up the bottle of soda pop Mariachi le behind and offers it to the other men on the table. They no, pay, and leave. The Bartender offers it to the MEAN D at the table. They all shake their heads no. The Bartender shrugs and dumps it.

Mariachi walks out and looks up and down the street. He  decides to walk south. As he walks down the sidewalk, the camera pans into a CLO of another guitar case that is moving towards the Corona  Club. The camera falls back a little revealing the backsi of Azul, dressed also in black. Azul walks into the bar.

Azul enters the bar, notices to his left the table with t four mean-looking Dudes, drinking and eating chips and sa The oldest one, with his back to Azul, takes a sip from h mixed drink, then stands and excuses himself to the restr
The Old Mean Dude walks into the first stall and sits dow
The three remaining Dudes notice Azul's guitar case. So d the Bartender. They all look at each other and laugh.
(laughing and rolling  his eyes) What the hell is this, mariachi day?  There is no work for you here!
Azul walks the mean Dude's table. Their laughing quiets d a bit as Azul stands before them. The Bartender stops smi
Bartender... one beer.
The Bartender nods and grabs a frosty glass. He begins to fill up at the tap.
(without looking at  him) In a bottle, wey.

Bartender stops filling the beer, stares at the half-full glass for a moment, then drinks the beer. Azul is staring at the three Mean Dudes. They stare back. The Bartender slaps the unopened bottle down at the count
Ready.
Azul doesn't pay attention to him.
I'm looking for an old friend of  mine. His name is... Moco. Do you  know where I can find him.
You can sometimes find him here. He  owns this place.
So you know him?
We work for him.
That's too bad.
Azul turns to the mean Dude sitting to his left, and plac the guitar in his hands. The Mean Dude is confused.
Hold it please.

Azul opens the case and pulls out the MAC-10. The other t Mean Dudes are already reaching for their pistols. The Bartender ducks beneath the counter. Azul fires a million bullets into two of the Mean Dudes,  (the other is holding the case in shock). Their chests  explode, causing neat little dollops of flesh and blood f everywhere. The Mean Dude holding the guitar case is froz with fear. He manages to look up at Azul, who is watching the Mean Dudes die a slow, bloody death. The barrel of th MAC-10 is smoking. Azul turns slowly to the Mean Dude hol the case. Azul aims his MAC-10 in the Dude's face. Still  frozen holding the case, he spends his last moments looki down the gun's barrel.

The shots caused Old Mean Dude to peer out from his stall the toilet paper fell to the ground and started to roll a the floor. He now watches it roll as more shots ring out. pulls up his pants and walks toward the door slowly. He i sweating profusely. He slowly picks up the toilet paper,  plotting his next move. It grows silent... He takes a dee breath and rushes out the door.

The Old Dude bursts into the room with a roll of toilet p in his hand, and a sheet of sweat sliding down his face. The Bartender rises up from behind the counter. The camera dollies slowly by the dead Dudes. Their blood- bathed faces twisted into odd shapes and expressions. The camera continues to dolly to the one dead Dude still hold the guitar case. His face is a bloody pulp. The camera st dollying to the old Dude's mixed drink. A hand is stirrin it with a straw. The camera pans up the arm to reveal Azu standing expressionless with his gun sling over his shoul Shot at 16fps the Old Dude quickly drops the toilet paper and runs back inside the bathroom. Azul turns to his guitar case and carefully chooses anoth weapon. He grabs the drink and tosses a napkin over his a like a waiter, then casually follows the Old Dude into th bathroom. The Bartenders glance at each other. One pours a shot gla full of tequila and raises it to his lips to drink it. Sh ring out and the Bartender spills the drink over himself. Without warning Azul bursts from the bathroom and walks c to his case. He replaces the weapon, picks up the case an leaves. A few seconds pass before the bartender grabs the phone a furiously dials.
(into phone) Get me Moco!!!

The door bursts open as Azul reenters, storming to the ba The Bartender is so petrified he doesn't think to drop th phone. Azul walks right up to the Bartender. The Bartender shuts his eyes. The sound of the beer bottl popping open can be heard, along with the sound of thirst guzzling. The Bartender opens his eyes to Azul. CLOSEUP of the empty bottle slamming to the counter. The Bartender glances down at the bottle. CLOSEUP of Azul tossing a few coins near the bottle as  payment. Azul leaves. A few seconds pass as the Bartender is standing there. Yo hear Moco yelling into the receiver asking what's going o
Moco is on the porch trying to get the Bartender to answe him.
(into phone) WHAT'S GOING ON OVER THERE, ANSWER  ME!!!
You hear Moco's voice through the phone. The camera dolli into the Bartender as he screams into the receiver. The camera dollies in to the corpses...
...and finally a low outdoor frontal tracking shot of Azu walking away smiling as the image fades out.
Low angle of Hotel Coahuila sign. MEAN DUDE #5 enters the frame as his beeper goes off. He runs into the Hotel Coah
Mean Dude #5 enters the lobby where an OLD CLERK is sitti at the counter reading a yellowed newspaper. There is a p bull on the floor beside him.
Da me telefono.
(without looking) Take it.
Mean Dude #5 grabs the phone and dials Moco's number. He  glances down at the PIT BULL lying on the floor.
Pit bull?
Yeah, pit bull.

The line is picked up and Mean Dude talks into the phone. pulls out a piece of paper from his coat pocket and place it on the counter. He begins jotting down four names. He  then slowly crosses their names out.
(into phone) Dead?
The Viejo Clerk glances up from his paper. The Pit Bull a glances up.
(into phone) All of them? How long ago? OK, What  does this guy look like?
Clerk goes back to reading his paper. Pit Bull is still p attention, though.

Same low-angle shot of the outdoor sign displaying the na Hotel Coahuila. Mariachi walks into frame, and pulls out wallet. Mariachi pulls out a few measly bucks then seems be considering what to do next.
An inside shot looking out of the front glass reveals Mar looking at his wallet as Mean Dude talks to the phone. No one notices him.
(into phone) ...carries a guitar case... And what  was he wearing?... all black...
The Pit Bull turns and looks out of the window. Seeing  Mariachi, he gets up and walks to it.
Mariachi is putting his last few dollars back into his wa As he is walking away he notices the Pit Bull and he bend down for a closer look.
(into phone) Don't worry, Moco. We'll find him,  and we'll mess him up real good. (ad lib)
Low shot with long lens at full zoom of Mariachi tapping glass. CLOSEUP of dog responding. CLOSEUP of Mariachi tapping.
Mean Dude hangs up the phone. He writes a few more things He turns to leave.
Gracias se?or...
As he passes the camera you can see Mariachi still playin with the dog. Inside view CLOSEUP of Mariachi tapping on  glass.
Callate, hombre!!!

Mariachi looks up at the Clerk, then stands. The Mean Dude turns around and looks and looks at the Cle Clerk turns to look at Mean Dude, who is walking back to counter. Mariachi picks his guitar from the ground. He is in full  view, but no one is looking at him.
Viejo, if you see anyone new in town,  carrying a guitar case, dressed in  black... you can call this number,  OK?
Mean Dude writes down a phone number and the description Azul on a little card.
(nodding sarcastically) And if I don't call, you'll kill  me...
(handing him the card) No. I won't kill you... he will...
The sarcastic smile fades from the old man. Mean Dude wal away. The old man reads the card, then glances out the wi Mariachi is gone.
Mariachi is turning a corner just as Mean Dude #5 exits t hotel. The Mean Dude walks off in the other direction.

Mariachi enters Domino's bar. DOMINO is waiting on a few bums that are nursing their jaws. Mariachi sits with them asks for a refresco, He gets looks again. Domino serves h and he asks to see the owner. She says he's looking at th owner. He then asks her for work as a mariachi. She says has no money to pay him. He looks around the classy joint and knows she's lying (it turns out to be true, she has n money). When he asks how a girl can take care of herself a town like this she stuffs a gun barrel in his mouth. He nurses his jaw, pays and leaves, as the others laugh.
Mariachi enters the run-down lobby of the motel. The Viej Clerk at the counter is reading his yellowed newspaper.  Mariachi sees the Pit Bull laying by the counter.
Pit bull.
Yeah, pit bull.
I need a cheap room for a week, and  I'd prefer to pay you in a few days,  after I've found some work.
S?, later...
Thank you...
The Old Man hands Mariachi a key for the second floor.
Thank you, friend.
As Mariachi walks away, the Clerk notices the guitar case and black clothes and he rereads the card Mean Dude left  him.
(different tone of  voice) Uh, excuse me se?or? I forgot, I  need a small deposit...
Mariachi stops in his tracks. He turns back to the Clerk  slowly... thinking.
(walking back slowly) You can trust me.
I am very sorry, se?or. But... how  much can you spare?
The dog is watching the event.
(disappointed) I've only got a few pesos... I plan  on finding work in town.
(grabbing money) Oh, that's enough for now, sir, thank  you and... enjoy your stay.

The Clerk deposits the money, slams the register shut, an continues reading his yellow paper. Confused, Mariachi po his empty wallet and turns to find his room. The Clerk pe over his paper, eyeing the guitar case as Mariachi goes. hears the sound of Mariachi's footsteps trailing off. The old man drops the paper and bolts silently to the phone a he dials El Moco's phone number...

Mariachi opens his room, tosses his guitar onto the bed a hangs his jacket in the closet. He has only his white T-s underneath. He glances above the bed to a plaque bearing mace and two crossed swords. He checks out the shower and washes his face in the sink. He sits down on his bed. A f seconds later he drops back and lays there a minute befor kicking the door shut. He tries to sleep.

The Old Clerk is talking on the phone to the bad guys. He hangs up the phone, then reaches into the back of his cou for a gun. He places it on the counter and covers it with his newspaper and continues reading.
Top shot of Mariachi sleeping. A shot of the mace on the  wall.

Mariachi is suddenly sleeping in the dirt. Same top shot in the hotel. He opens his eyes, then groggily he sits up ESTABLISHING SHOT of Mariachi sitting in the middle of a  ghost town. He stands up. VARIOUS SHOTS of the empty town with nothing and nobody. Medium shot dolly into Mariachi as he stands, turns and s a BOY bouncing a ball in slow motion. The Boy stops short holding the ball tight against the chest. Mariachi glance around to maybe spot more people, before concentrating on the Boy. The Boy places the ball carefully on the ground, then gen rolls it to Mariachi. Tracking shot of the ball rolling to Mariachi. The ball s like a speeding truck. Mariachi smiles at the boy. CLOSEUP of the ball rolling. CLOSEUP of the Boy smiling. Mariachi bends to get the ball which makes the sound of a screeching truck as it hits Mariachi's foot. Mariachi not that it's a man's severed head.
Mariachi bolts up in bed.
The Mean Dudes jump out of their truck and rush into the  hotel, guns drawn.
The men burst into the lobby and the old men tells them t room number. They run out into the courtyard with the old man following. The Pit Bull is uninterested in the action

The Mean Dudes run up the courtyard stairs and kick open first door they come to and start blasting into the room. Screams are heard. The men stand back, and finally look d the steps at the Viejo Clerk who is waving his arms  frantically.
127!!! Cuarto 127, pendejos!!!
They run to the room numbered 127 and cautiously stalk to it as they reload their guns.
Mariachi is sitting on his bed listening to all this. He  bolts to the restroom and turns to the shower.
Shot of men still stalking, cocking pistols. POV shot of what men see, as camera nears the door.
Mariachi rushes out of the bathroom towards the door.
As camera nears the door, doorknob starts to move. Rememb that he never locked the door, he jumps to the side of th door as...
Men kick open the door and burst into the room.

Low-angle shot as men burst in. There is no one in the ro Mean Dude #5 hears the shower and motions to keep it down and stalk quietly... They rush into the bathroom and star blasting. Mariachi slips out from behind the door and runs out.
Mariachi runs out of the room and jumps off the stairwell onto the courtyard in front of the Clerk.
(pointing to his room) Cuidado, viejo!
Mariachi darts out into the lobby. The old man watches hi go then turns his attention back to Mariachi's room.
(pointing in Mariachi's  direction) Pendejos!!!
The dog watches as Mariachi tosses his keys into the cubb hole where they belong. Mariachi then jumps over the coun banging keys on the register to get it open.
The Mean Dudes run out of Mariachi's room, dart down the  stairs, passing the old man who is telling them where to

Mariachi, unable to open the register, jumps over the cou CLOSEUP of his feet as he lands, causing the register to  burst open. Mariachi turns for a second to ponder getting his money o risking dying, but then he checks to turn and run. Two se later the Mean Dudes run in, one jumps over the counter t see if he's there.
Mariachi runs atop the Mean Dudes' parked truck then jump into the bed of a passing truck. Mean Dudes run outside. Dudes have their hands up as if they don't know what to l for.
He wears black!
Shots of lots of people walking around, wearing black ite

The truck turns a corner and the driver halts, comes out  with a gun and tell Mariachi to get the hell out of his t Mariachi leaps out. He is about to continue running, but stops, clenches his fists, and turns slowly as the camera dollies into his face.
Camera dollies into the guitar case on Mariachi's bed.

Mariachi runs back in the direction of the hotel, but as turns the corner he has to slow down for the Mean Dudes a everywhere. Each one has his gun out and is looking aroun for the man in black. Mariachi walks slowly, whistling an nodding to everyone as they pass. A few look suspiciously him but continue searching. Mariachi ducks inside the hot
Mariachi enters the lobby and winks at the old Clerk who standing over his open register in shock. His eyes widen  when he sees Mariachi. He runs out of the hotel.
(screaming, pointing  inside) PENDEJOS!!!

Mariachi rushes in, grabs his jacket and puts it on. He g his guitar case and squeezes it tight, his eyes shut. Slo dolly into him, as his eyes open. CLOSEUP of plaque on wall with mace and swords. He grabs mace, swinging it around a few times. He feels secure, no He turns to leave.

Mariachi rushes out the door, he looks down and sees the  Mean Dudes entering the courtyard. He ducks his head back just as they look up to see him. Mariachi runs up a small flight of steps, where he then tosses his guitar onto a  balcony, which he then jumps over to himself. The men rush up the steps shooting at the balcony. Bullet narrowly miss Mariachi as he climbs over the balcony to  safety.
Mariachi dashes down the hallway out onto a balcony. He s no way down.

The Mean Dudes are climbing over the balcony like spiders Mariachi runs back and slams his guitar into the first gu to make it over the balcony. His dummy falls down the sta and over the narrow railing. The Dude splats on the groun in gruesome CLOSEUP. The old man looks over at him as he dies, then turns back if nothing happened. Mariachi bolts back down the hill.
Mariachi is looking down the balcony trying to find a way escape. Mariachi looks behind him.
Mean Dudes barrel down the hallway reloading the guns.
Mariachi flings his mace over an electric cable, then sta on the balcony lip, placing his guitar between his legs.
Mariachi is sliding down the cable and turns back to see  Mean Dudes firing guns at him. Bus stops in traffic and  Mariachi grabs his guitar and jumps onto the hood of the  bus.

Mariachi jumps onto another car and then down into the st Mean Dudes exit the hotel and chase him on foot while a f get in the truck and chase him. The truck takes a short c Mariachi is running through the sidewalks and streets in  front of curioso shops, jumping small carts and children cars to escape the two men behind him. He enters a small  cutoff where the truck tries to stop him by heading off. bad guys stick their heads and guns out of their windows laugh as they ready to shoot him. Mariachi, though, alrea having built momentum, runs right up the front of the tru as the guys try to shoot him but not succeed in only shoo each other as he runs up and over the cab, into the bed, onto the street. He swings his guitar case into another g groin and grabs his gun, re-aiming it to shoot Mean Dude Mariachi shoots him in the arm, and Mean Dude #5 drops hi gun and cowers away in pain. Mariachi then turns the guy' gun on him and shoots him in the chest. Mariachi grabs hi case and as Mean Dude #5 turns to get s look at him, all sees is the case coming into his face. Mariachi heads bac for Domino's.

Mariachi stumbles through city streets, pausing against a telephone pole as he gazes at Domino's Saloon across the  street. Mariachi stumbles across, almost getting hit by a few car and drags himself into the saloon.
Mariachi staggers into Amadeus and washes his face in a  fountain by the door. He makes his way to the bar as a pa pays and leaves.
What happened to you, Mariachi? Too  much refresco?
I just killed four guys.
Domino turns around and looks at Mariachi, wondering hard he's joking. He lifts up a bloody hand, grabs a napkin, a then seems to ask permission with his eyes before wiping hands clean.
Is it true?
Mariachi nods an ashamed yes. Domino reaches for her gun under the counter. The camera is on Mariachi when she brings it out and poin at him.
(exhausted) Wait a minute... what's your name?
Domino.
Wait a minute, Domino! It was self- defense.
She cocks the pistol.
(frantic) I'm new in town. I don't know  everyone!!! I have no friends here...  and no enemies.
(lowering the gun a  bit) Thieves?

(nodding) No way. They were well-dressed men.  I checked into the cheapest hotel in  town, no money, nothing of value,  except this guitar and maybe this  coat, which they could have taken  when I left my room, but they didn't.  They were only interested in killing  me.
(lifting the gun back  up) So why do you come here? You want to  get me killed?
I need a place to stay until I figure  this out. They've got me mixed up  with someone else.
And you've never seen them before?  Not even in another town?
(long pause) Are you saying they followed me, a  mariachi, here? What for?
Maybe they hate your music.
Mariachi stares at her expressionless. She stares back at him.
Maybe you were singing in another  town, they hated your voice, and now  they're trying to kill you.
Are you serious?
(nodding) Yes.
She laughs.
Are you going to help me, or am I  gonna have to die on your porch?
I have a room upstairs. My room.  Don't touch anything. I'll be up  after awhile and we can call a friend  of mine.
Mariachi shakes her hand.
Thank you. I'll never forget this.
He tries to kiss her hand. She slides it away and effortl slaps him.
This way.
He follows her to a doorway revealing an unlit staircase. When he enters, the darkness swallows him as she shuts th door behind him.

Mariachi enters a roomy, luxurious apartment above the ma bar. There is a free-standing porcelain tub in the center the room. Mariachi places his guitar halfway between the  entrance and the tub. The camera is tracking backwards wi him as he walks, making the room look endless. He removes his jacket as he makes his way to the tub. He drops his j onto the floor and gently climbs into the tub. The camera faces him as he settles back. The camera slowly dollies i him as he lays back, crosses his fingers, and gives a rel smile.

Domino is washing a glass. She then remembers she has the gun in her waist belt, so she removes it and sticks it ba under the counter. Wounded Mean Dude #5 comes in limping. She takes out a towel and drops it on the counter.
Good morning, Domino.
What happened?
Give me the phone. I have to call  Moco.
She brings up the phone and sets it down where the cloth  was. He picks up the cloth and wraps his arm with it.
It's not as bad as it looks. Domino,  has anyone come through here? A  stranger, maybe?
This is a border town. I get strangers  all the time.
Dressed all in black, carrying a  guitar case?
No.
Well, he shot me... and has killed  ten of Moco's men... all in one day.
Domino looks a little upset. She slides the phone towards him a bit.
Aren't you gonna call your boss?
(nodding) I have to tell Moco that he got away  again... So, you better give me a  drink first.
Domino smiles and pours him half a beer mug with tequila. laughs and drinks. As he's dialing, the camera is on Domi as she cleans up a few things, every once in a while glan upstairs.

(into phone) Moco, he got away. Shot me in the  arm. Killed La Palma. Pepino, Sunday.  This guy is one slick maricon. Yeah.  Also, I didn't get a look at him.  So, unless he's still carrying that  guitar around and hasn't changed  clothes, I won't even spot him, and  I don't think he'll be that obvious...

Don't worry. If there's one thing I  know, it's that he'll always wear  black and he'll always carry that  guitar with him. It's his signature.  Besides, that's not a guitar he's  carrying. It's a guitar case full of  weapons. Find him.
Mean Dude hangs up and puts his head in his hands.
Que paso?
I screwed up. The guy left his guitar  case in the hotel room. We chased  him out, but he came back for the  case.
Maybe he loves his guitar. It's  probably an antique.
It wasn't a guitar. It was a guitar  case full of weapons that he uses on  his victims. Adios, I'm gonna take a  nap. And thanks for the drink.
Mean Dude #5 stumbles as he tries to stand.
If you see this guy, call us.

He is about to walk off with the bloody towel and he turn back pointing at it. She waves her hand at him, as if gra him permission to take it. She cleans his glass, and when is gone she slams the glass down and runs for the stairs. few seconds later she comes back into the bar, grabs the from under the counter and calls her assistant to watch t bar. He sees the gun and wonders what she's up to. She st upstairs.
Domino opens the door abruptly and finds Mariachi taking bath. He bolts upright, pulls a towel up from the floor a sits frozen waiting for Domino's next move. She laughs an walks to the counter.
(friendly) I thought I told you not to touch  anything.
Sorry. I needed to relax. I can...
(smiling) No, it's alright, Finish up. Do you  want shampoo?
(laying back, closed  eyes) Yes, please.

Domino turns to a counter and her smile fades. She looks  like she wants to rip Mariachi's throat out with her teet She puts the gun down on the counter. She finds an ominou looking knife and then grabs a bottle of shampoo. She wal over to him, then pulls the knife up to his throat with o hand while grabbing his hair with the other. He opens his eyes wide. The shampoo hits the floor and begins to roll.
Who are you?!
(choking) I'm a musician!
The shampoo bottle rolls into the guitar case and stops.  Domino sees this, and with her foot reaches out and pulls the case toward her.
What do you have in here? GUNS?  KNIVES?
Mariachi tries to catch his breath, pausing before answer her as if wondering if all this is really happening.
No! My guitar!
Domino slides her foot out of her shoe, and unsnaps one o the latches with her toe.
We'll see...
She unsnaps another. The latches snap loud and echo in th quiet room. Mariachi gasps as she tightens her grip.
You're very modest, Mariachi...
She squeezes his hair and unsnaps another latch.
(through gritted teeth) You told me you killed four men,  when you really killed seven. Or  were they still breathing even you  shot out their hearts?
Another latch snaps.
(growing dizzy) I'm a mariachi...
...not a murderer...
Aren't you going to watch?
She lifts the lid with her foot. It seems an eternity bef the case is fully open. Domino is looking into the case, Mariachi is not. He knows what's in there.
I told you... I am a musician.

Slow dolly into the case, which contains a white, well-ke classical guitar. Domino is seeing it, and for a moment s almost believes he is telling the truth. She rushes to it, grabs the guitar and tosses it to Maria He catches it, choking after she releases the blade. She on the other side of the tub, now. She jams the knife dow between Mariachi's legs. Mariachi's eyes bug.
Play it.
(still choking) W... w... what?
Domino shoves the knife in deeper and Mariachi grimaces  horribly.
Play it, damnit, play something  sweet!!!
Mariachi is sweating and his face is extremely red. He pa for a long time before plucking an odd note. She squints if she's caught him. But he eventually starts picking out sweet little melody.
(growing impatient) SING!
Mariachi starts to sing but chokes on the words. He start over, playing a "Rancho Grande" sounding song with his ow made up words.

(in a high sweet voice) What is this place? That treats me  like a murderer? They've all got  their heads up their butts... Even  this beautiful girl, With a knife to  my balls, Should I kiss her or hit  her... Or both?
He finishes his song, bowing and thanking his imaginary  audience. Domino is smiling. She pulls the knife slowly o of the water and wipes it off on her apron.
You're a mariachi, all right. And a  good one.
Mariachi bows a solemn thank you.
I think this is the best I've ever  played. You... inspired me.
CLOSEUP of the knife. She laughs.
Hire me.
Domino looks at him with a silent "what?".
I'm good. Hire me to play in your  bar. I'll work mostly from tips.  But, I need steady work.
I couldn't pay you. I have no money.
This fancy place and you have no  money?
It's the truth.
I'll work for room and board, then.  Please, I'm desperate.
(thinking) Will I have to keep a knife at your  balls to get you to play like that?
(smiling) Not if you're paying me room and  board. Please... until I find a  permanent job.
(thinking) You won't find a permanent job in  this town... but OK.

She gets up slowly, and turns to leave. Mariachi settles  back, smiling triumphantly. Suddenly she darts around and slams the knife between his legs again with a furious loo on her face. He bolts up out of this triumphant daze with look of complete shock. She loosens up and laughs.
You're going to need a better sense  of humor than that, if you're gonna  work for me, kid.

She flings her knife aside. It sticks into a wall. She sh smiles a beautiful smile, turns, and goes downstairs. Mar settles back down, closing his eyes. The knife slips out the wall and clangs to the ground. Mariachi jumps again,  rolls his eyes, and sinks underwater as the picture fades
Mariachi plays in Amadeus.

Camera tracks past a pool table where TWO RATS are playin nine ball. They make a few shots, then the phone rings. T camera continues to track past a small table where Azul's guitar case lies open. Weapons adorn it, with each knife, each gun in its pocket, in its own place. The camera cont tracking to a dresser on which sits Azul's cellular phone delicate female hand lifts the receiver. The camera is no positioned above the bed as the GIRL answers the phone.
(into phone) Yes? One moment please...

He rolls over and wakes a GIRL sleeping beside her. Girl takes the phone and passes it to a third GIRL as Girl #2  tries to wake Azul (he is sleeping between Girls #2 and # Girl #3 has the phone to her ear as if listening for  background conversation. The two Rats playing pool are staring longingly at the th Girls in Azul's bed. They look hungry and deprived. One h the other, signaling it's his shot. While one shoots, the other watches. Azul awakens and grabs the phone.
(into phone) Yeah.
Moco is sitting in his pool. A swimming WAITER is bringin him drinks.
(into phone) Amigo! I'm glad I've reached you!  You've not answered all day. Killing  ten of my men must have been very  time consuming!
(into phone) Six.
(into phone) What?
(into phone) I've only killed six! You were always  bad at maths, Moco. I guess that's  why you never paid me half of the  money. You thought it all belonged  to you.

(into phone) I knew half was yours... I got greedy,  my friend. It's my nature. But you!!!  You are modest! You've killed ten of  my men!! I know, because I'm having  them buried in my yard right now.  With my dogs and cats.
(counting on his  fingers, into phone) I killed six. But don't bother  counting so soon. The number will  triple by tomorrow.
(into phone) I'm sorry things turned out this  way. My friend. I got greedy. I should  never have tried to kill you. It  would have been cheaper for me to  pay you. Now I've got to find ten  new men.
(into phone) Six.
(into phone) Ten.
(into phone) I tell you what. You give me my money,  and I won't kill any more of your  men... And I won't kill you.
(takes a sip, into  phone) No, it's too late for that. We're  going to have to see this through.
(into phone) Just like the Moco I used to know.  Still wearing white?
(looking down at his  clothes, into phone) What do you think?
(into phone) I think you should change clothes.  I'd hate to ruin a white suit with  your stupid blood.

Azul hangs up. He gets dressed and leaves. The little Rat are about to follow, but one Rat walks over to get one lo at the girls. The girls tease him, and when he tries to  advance them, they pull guns and laugh as the Rat runs aw
Domino walks by with a trash can. Mariachi is sitting on barstool.
I need to get my money back from  that hotel. I'll be right back.
Are you crazy? If you go anywhere  with that jacket and that case you  could be killed. Leave that stuff  here.
Mariachi gets up and is about to get his guitar case from under the stool. Mariachi leaves it under the stool and takes off the jack
I never go anywhere without it. Take  care of it.
Mariachi leaves. Domino drops the trash can and tells her assistant to watch the bar. She heads for the staircase.

Domino walks out onto her balcony, peering down into the  street. POV shot of Mariachi walking through the street. Domino turns and walks to the phone. She dials a number b heart and sits in a plush chair.
Moco answers the phone. Towel around his neck, wet hair.
(dolly in slow, into  phone) Hi. It's Domino.
(into phone) I know who it is...
Dolly into Moco.

The Clerk is reading a paper. He hears a noise and pulls aside. Mariachi is standing at the counter smiling. The C jumps in his seat, then after a few frozen seconds he set down his paper and reaches for Mariachi's old room key. Mariachi shakes his head "no", points to the register, an makes the money sign with his hand. The Clerk slowly move over to the register. He depresses a few keys to open it. won't open. He makes a gesture like it's stuck or somethi (he is not very convincing). He tries again and again; ea time pretending to get more impatient. Mariachi glances d at the Pit Bull. The Pit Bull is eyeing Mariachi. Mariach points to the Clerk as if he has an inside joke with the ("this guy..."). Mariachi climbs over the counter and sta next to the Clerk. The Clerk thinks Mariachi is a lunatic Mariachi holds up a finger as if cueing the Clerk for a  demonstration. Mariachi then leaps over the counter landi firmly back on the other side of the counter. CLOSEUP of his feet landing hard, just as before. The register opens. Mariachi shrugs, smiles, and reaches  into the register, taking his money out himself. He count it. After a brief consideration, he decides to leave the man a tip. Mariachi waves a "good-bye" wave and dances ou The old man, still standing there with his arms outstretc as if he was robbed, dashes to the phone and calls Moco's men.

The bar Assistant is cleaning the bar. He walks over to g a few glasses and when he returns, Azul is sitting at the barstool Mariachi was on earlier. The Assistant looks aro wondering where Azul appeared from.
Can I get something to drink or eat?
One beer.
The Assistant grabs a mug and starts to fill it at the ta He fills it halfway when...
In a bottle, wey.
(laughs) Sorry.
He grabs a bottle and hands it to Azul, then lifts the mu toasts and drinks it straight down. Azul drinks his straight down, too.
(looking around) Isn't there a girl that works here?
Yeah, she owns the place.
(heading a few bills  to the Assistant) She owns it, now? Then she is Moco's  girl?
(looking around) So-so. She's onto this new musician.
Azul takes out a few more bills and hands them to the  Assistant, and begins to stand up.
Thank you.
Mariachi is out on the streets, returning to Domino's.
As he crosses the street he notices Azul leaving the salo with a guitar case. Mariachi runs into the saloon.
Mariachi runs inside and checks to see if his case is sti there. Domino comes downstairs.
I just saw a guy with a guitar case  like mine. It's him they want.
(to Assistant) Did he say anything?
(nodding) No, he just ordered a drink.
I don't look anything like him...
Azul is walking to his truck when he turns to a corner an Mean Dude #4 sticks his gun in his face. Two more guns ap pointed at the back of his head.
Is this the guy?
I'm not sure...

The two Rats are in the blue truck half a block away. One hits the other to look at what's happening to Azul. POV of Rats seeing Azul with three guys around him with g They look at each other, start the truck and speed away.
What's in the case?
My guitar.
Yeah? You're one of those old-time  mariachis, huh?
(pause) Yes.
OK, let's take a look.
Mean Dude #4 takes the case and lays it flat in Azul's pa
If it's a guitar like you say it is,  we'll never bother you again...
Mean Dude #4 unsnaps two of the latches, SNAP... SNAP.
If it's not...
He unsnaps three more... SNAP... SNAP... SNAP!
...then we'll spray paint this street  with your brains.

He points the gun deep into Azul's face and cocks it. Azu closes his eyes. Mean Dude #5 lifts the lid. Azul hears a faint strumming sound, followed by the sound of the Mean  Dude slamming the case shut. Azul opens his eyes. The Mea Dude resnaps the latches. SNAP... SNAP... SNAP-SNAP-SNAP!
(walking away) Sorry....
They walk away leaving Azul wondering what happened.
Domino, Mariachi, and Assistant are standing at the bar.
Look, as long as you don't carry the  case around, they'll leave you alone.  It's that guy they're after.
(putting on his coat) I better put this upstairs...
He grabs the case and begins to take it to the stairs, bu he pauses for it feels different to him. He slowly looks  down at it.
Azul watches the Mean Dudes go and when they turn the cor he puts the case on the ground to open it.
The Mean Dudes are rounding the corner, but Mean Dude #5, who is last, snaps his fingers and motions to the others keep quiet and to watch Azul
Mariachi shakes the case, and puts it on the counter as i to open it... but he doesn't need to check it. He knows i not his guitar.
What's wrong?
Mariachi looks at her startled, then runs out of the bar  with the case.
Mean Dudes are watching Azul unsnap his case.
Azul opens the lid, revealing Mariachi's guitar.
That's him...

The Mean Dudes start walking towards Azul as the camera t back with them. Azul slams the case shut, wondering what hell is going on. He looks up and notices the Mean Dudes  walking towards him. He stands up and slowly walks in the other direction.
Mariachi is running through the streets and onto the side

The bad guys are pulling out their weapons. Mariachi bolts around the corner. Now everyone is on the  same sidewalk. Mariachi and Azul are on each end of the s with the Mean Dudes in between them. Azul turns and sees Mariachi with his guitar case. Mean D #5 turns and sees Mariachi, too.
That's him...
The two other Mean Dudes exchange glances. Mean Dude #5 s after Mariachi, so the other two follow. Mariachi looks t Azul for help. Azul tips the imaginary hat to Mariachi an walks away.
Mariachi runs through the street almost getting hit. Bull are flying as the Mean Dudes are firing at him as they ru

Mariachi leaps up over a few cars and ends up in a dead e He turns around, drops the case on the ground and opens i A million weapons seem to stare back at him when he opens it. He is frantic. He grabs a small gun, shakes it in his hand, doesn't like the feel. He tosses it back in.
The Mean Dudes are barreling down the street. One turns  towards the dead end.

Mariachi pulls out the MAC-10 and blasts the first Mean D he sees. He grabs the case and runs out into the street,  jumping onto a truck and blasting the other Mean Dude fro up there. He sees Mean Dude #5 run away. Mariachi comes off the truck and walks through the street in slow motion. People are staring at him as if he was Az the killer. Mariachi walks straight to the bar. A BOY is  bouncing a ball on one of the sidewalks.

The camera dollies past the vacant pool table, and over t Rat sitting in a chair, drinking a beer. The other Rat is pacing back and forth in front of the sitting Rat. Azul e the room. Throwing his guitar case onto the pool table as grand entrance gesture. The sitting Rat stands beside the pacing Rat.
I'm sorry we left...
...We didn't know what to do...
...We figured you could defend  yourself!!!
Rat #2 nods in agreement. Azul unsnaps one of the latches
You thought I could defend myself...
...against three armed men...
...using this?
He opens the case and the guitar sparkles at them. The Ra exchange glances. They look at the guitar then back at Az
My case got switched with some maricon  mariachi!
Where is this mariachi?
He's dead by now... So, I want you  to go look for my case.
The two Rats are about to leave.
Leave me a weapon.
Both Rats take out their guns. Azul takes Rat #2's gun.
That was disloyal of you to leave me  out there. You should be as loyal to  me as you are to each other.
The Rats exchange glances, then aim their eyes back to th floor. Azul turns to Rat #2.
Are you loyal?
(after glancing at  Rat #1) Yes.
(to Rat #1) Are you loyal?
Yes.
Azul gestures to Rat #2.
Then shoot him.
Rat #1 turns to Rat #2 who is in shock.
You are loyal, are you not? SHOOT  HIM. Or I shoot you.
Azul aims his gun at Rat #1, who immediately aims his gun Rat #2. Rat #2 is sweating bullets. Rat #1 puts his gun d
I can't.
Why not?
You said we should be as loyal to  you as we are to each other. I  couldn't shoot him, for that would  be as disloyal as shooting you.
Rat #2 glances back and forth between Rat #1 and Azul.
Very good. Now go find my case.
Azul puts his gun down and motions the rats to leave. The leave. When they exit, Rat #1 turns to Rat #2 and snaps h fingers. Rat #2 shakes his hand. They leave.
Domino is dabbing hydrogen peroxide onto a cotton swab. S applies it to Mariachi's body scars on his back. Mariachi has his eyes closed. He washes the blood from his face.
Where were you when he came into the  bar?
I was on the phone, talking to a  friend that knows what's going on.
Did you mention me?
No... He told me the man in black is  Azul.
If his name is Azul, why doesn't he  wear blue?
I don't know... Anyway, he's killing  the men of the town drug dealer. The  dealer's name is Mauricio. But he's  known as Moco.
And Moco is sending these men to  find Azul. So, why do they chase me?
They have never seen Azul... only  Moco knows him. My friend says the  description Moco gave his men was  that he wears black, and carries a  guitar case. Sounds like you, no?
Couldn't you tell your friend that  there are two people like that in  his town? One is a killer, and one  is a mariachi.

Only special people can talk to Moco.  Besides, you've killed a few of his  men, now. Your best option is to  keep out of sight, stop wearing black,  and to hide that stupid case until  this is all over.
Mean Dude #5 comes in and approaches Moco.
He got away... but I got a good look  at him.
Moco takes out a cigarette and puts it in his mouth.
Coca, Caca, Beto were killed.
Moco takes out a match.
He won't get away again, Moco. I  promise.
Moco lights his match across Mean Dude #5's face and ligh his cigarette. Mean Dude #5 walks away, as Moco flicks hi match at him in slow motion.
Mariachi is about to lay on the floor. She tosses him a  blanket.
Are you always closed Monday nights,  or did you close since I can't play  my guitar tonight?
Mondays are my day off. Want to play  a game?
Sure.
The phone rings. Domino gets up to answer it. Mariachi re under his blanket for a small mirror and combs his hair,  putting spit in his hair to slick it down. He quickly sta the mirror.
(into phone) Hello?
(into phone) Come see me.
(into phone) I can't.
(into phone) Please.
Moco is sitting at a table playing cards.
(into phone) I don't feel well. I've got to go.
(into phone) Have you ridden the bike?
(into phone) No... I've got to go...
She hangs up.
Boyfriend.
(quiet as if thinking) No...
I can't figure out something. You  tell me you're poor. Poor family.  Yet you've got this place.
(sighing) This place is a gift.
From who?
From Mauricio.
From EL MOCO? The man trying to kill  me?
He's not trying to kill you, his man  had you confused with Azul.
Same thing.
Look, you know how if you want to  impress a girl, you send her flowers,  candy, jewelry until you win her  love?
Yes.
If one present doesn't work, you  keep sending bigger and better things  until you win her or you're broke?
Correct...
Well, Mauricio sent me flowers, then  jewelry, then he gave me a job at  his saloon, then he gave me the whole  saloon... etc.
He's still giving you things?
He'll never run out of money.
And you accept it all? What's the  last thing he sent you?
Domino walks over to the counter and picks up a key.
A motorcycle.
Mariachi laughs.
He wants me to ride out to his ranch  when I've decided to be his. He thinks  he's close to having me.
Is he?
(pause) He was.
She sits next to Mariachi.
Not anymore.
They kiss. She gets up and is about to turn off the light
So, you really are from a poor family.

(in the dark) I remember when I was growing up, we  were so poor, that my brothers and  sisters and I all slept on the same  blanket stretched out across the  floor. We had to sleep in a circle,  with our fingers in each other's  ears, to keep the bugs from crawling  into them.
(after a pause) Ay, wey...
Domino laughs.
Domino hands Mariachi a wad of money. Mariachi sees the money and looks up at her bewildered.
Here's a little bit I've saved. I  want you to go get a new guitar.
Mariachi starts to put up his hand as if to refuse it.
Take it, stupid. I'm not saying go  by the best one, just a temporary  one so you can play again tonight.
Mariachi stops and thinks... He looks up at her questioni then he shrugs an "OK" and grabs the money and jogs out  excitedly. Domino is smiling.

Mariachi walks down the sidewalk, passing curioso shops. camera is low and zoomed in all the way. Mariachi stops b one of the window that has a guitar in the glass. He pull his money and counts it. He stops after he notices someon reflection in the window. He turns around and sees it is  Mean Dude #5 right across the street. He meets up with an Mean Dude. They are standing right behind Mariachi. Maria is pretending to still look at the window. The Mean Dudes walk past Mariachi so Mariachi walks in the opposite  direction. Mean Dude #5 stops and then turns around slowl Far zoomed shot of Mariachi walking down the street with  guys behind him. They start after him.
That's him...
Tracking shot following Mariachi. Tracking shot in front of Mean Dudes walking at Mariachi. Mean Dude #5 pulls out a small walkie-talkie and calls hi buddy in the truck a block away.
(into walkie-talkie) Loco, he's headed your way... black  pants, white shirt.

head_text.subj: IN A TRUCK DOWN THE STREET

text: LOCO starts the truck and starts driving slowly across th street. As he turns on the corner, Mariachi sees the truc and casually climbs inside and hides in the back. Mean Du #5 turns the corner when whispers into walkie-talkie.
(into walkie-talkie) Where did he go, Loco?
(laughs, into walkie- talkie) He got in my truck.
Mean Dude #5 laughs.
(into walkie-talkie) Take him around the block.

Mean Dude #5 taps his buddy and they start running down t block. Mariachi is in back the truck searching for a weapon. The truck stops. Mariachi rolls to the side and gently lifts head. POV Mariachi sees the two Mean Dudes walking at him. Mari turns and Loco is there to knock him in the face with the rifle butt. Mariachi falls into truck, blood trickling fr his dizzying head. He tries to get up a bit, but Loco is the truck now, and slams the rifle down into his face har Blackout.
Mariachi is unconscious in the back of Loco's truck. Mean Dude #5 and other Mean Dudes are riding in back with Mari

The above scene intercuts back and forth with the arrival Loco. Loco arrives at the gate, Mean Dude #5 opens the ga they drive through. The truck is facing Moco so he can't Mariachi yet. Mean Dude #5 closes the gate and walks over the truck, opens the back door, and calls Moco over. Moco walks over to the truck and looks inside.
Mariachi is laying there unconscious, Moco puts his arm a Mean Dude #5, who is looking very proud, and Moco pulls o a cigarette and a match.
That's not him.
Moco strikes the match behind Mean Dude #5's head. Mean D #5 stops smiling.
Domino is waiting on customers. She glances at her watch. few seconds later she glances at it again. She looks very worried.

Azul's Rats burst into the hideout. FOUR GIRLS pop up ove the partition with guns. The Rats stop in their tracks. T girls sigh a "oh, it's them" sigh and slink back to bed. shot of them trying to wake Azul. Azul wakes up and looks over the partition.
Where's my case?
We couldn't find it.
We heard they caught you and were  taking you to Moco's ranch.
...so we came to see if it was true.
Azul thinks a moment. He stands up.
They caught the mariachi.
Azul dresses, smiling...

Mariachi is in a holding cell at the ranch. He twitches,  finally waking up. He sees a GUARD outside and finds a way to escape. He grabs the guard's assault rifle and turns a corner. Tw men grab him. He slams the butt of the rifle, knocking th wind and teeth out of BAD GUY #1, then he kicks down and  breaks the shin bone of BAD GUY #2 who screams out in ago Mariachi silences him by karate punching his throat. The Guy gurgles and hits the ground. Angle from the ground as Mariachi smashes the guy with is gun. He crawls up a wall, trying to escape as quietly as he ca He sees TWO MORE MEN running towards him since they heard some noise. Mariachi aims his assault rifle at the blue C parked behind him. He fires and it explodes. Mariachi jumps Loco, gets him to drive him to the saloon. also takes Loco's money.
Azul walks into frame, looks around then proceeds into th bar.
Azul goes inside and finds Domino tending the bar.
What can I get you?
One beer.
She grabs a bottle and slams it down on the counter unope He eyes her admirably and then pops the top with one hand He guzzles the drink, slamming it down empty.
Anything else?
(nodding) My guitar case.
Where's Mariachi?
Where's my case?
Upstairs.
Get it.
Domino grabs another beer for him and runs to get the cas (In between this time, Mariachi escapes with Loco.) She returns, slamming it to the floor.
If you want your mariachi back, come  with me.
Why will you help me?
Because you know where Moco's ranch  is... I don't.
Domino calls her Assistant.
You help me, I'll help you.
Let's go.
They leave. The Assistant tends to the bar.

They drive out to Moco's ranch in Azul's truck. Little do they know, they passed Loco's truck with Mariachi crouche in the passenger seat. He gets up after the truck passes. Mariachi didn't know it was Domino in Azul's truck or he  could have turned around and kept her from going to Moco' ranch. They arrive at the gate and get out of the truck.
(over the gate) Mauricio!!
Azul grabs Domino and points a gun to her head. He whispe to her...
Play along...
He kicks at the gate.
Open the gate or she's dead!
The gate opens and we see Moco standing at a three-quarte stance, flanked with his men on both sides. Azul drags Do in and faces her at Moco with a gun to her head.
(to Domino) I'm sorry he used you to get to me,  Domino.
Azul cocks the pistol.
Azul, let her go and you'll get your  money.
Moco, give me my money or I ruin  your clothes with her blood.
Moco signals his men to get the money.
What have you done with Mariachi?
Who?
The musician your men confused with  Azul.
(staring at her) So that's why you were busy that  night...
Azul is glancing between Domino and Moco.
...you had that little monkey climbing  all over you.
Give me my money or I kill her NOW!!!
After all I've done for you, this is  how you treat me?
I never asked you for anything until  now. Let Mariachi go.
Azul is anxious now.
I swear I'll kill her!
No you won't. I will.

Moco pulls out his gun and shoots her in the heart. She f limp in Azul's arms. Azul tries hold her up, but she's de Azul rests her on the ground, looking down at her, wonder why it's all come to this.
All I wanted was my rightful share.  But you've got to kill everybody.
You feel sorry for her, don't you?  See, that's why you can't ever be as  big as me.
Azul slowly looks at Moco.
(aiming gun) Because you have too much heart.

Moco shoots Azul in the heart. Azul had his hands to his  side, and now he falls to his knees. Moco shoots him agai and Azul dies next to Domino. Mean Dude #5 is exchanging glances with the others. No on seems to be on Moco's side.
Mariachi is still in Loco's truck.
Stop here.
Loco stops the truck and Mariachi gets out. Loco drives b when Mariachi motions for him to leave. Mariachi watches go then dashes around the corner to the saloon.
Mariachi runs into the bar...
Domino!!! We're leaving!!! Right  now!!!
The Assistant rushes over to Mariachi.
She's gone.
Where is she?
Looking for you.
Mariachi is about to race upstairs.
She gave the case back to that guy.  She left with him to find you.
Mariachi tries to make sense of it all for a minute befor grabbing the gun from under the counter and rushing upsta
Mariachi grabs the key to the motorcycle and runs out. Th motorcycle burns down the road.

head_text.subj: MARIACHI ON THE ROAD TO MOCO'S

text: Mariachi barrels down the road on the motorcycle.
Moco is walking away from the bodies.
Bring that musician out here so he  can be reunited with my Domino.
Some men go to check. Cut back and forth with Mariachi coming.
He's gone, sir.
Find him!!

Mariachi rides through the semi-open gate... stopping at bodies. He dismounts the bike and holds Domino. He has the gun in the back of his pants. You can see it w his back is to the camera and men are approaching him. Mo comes for the show.
(good shot) So you're the little mariachi that  came to town, killed my men, and  stole my girl...
Mariachi slowly lifts his eyes to Moco.
You are very talented.
Mariachi stands, hands up.
I bet you play the guitarra real  well, huh?
Mariachi says nothing.
(raising gun) Not anymore.

Moco fires into Mariachi's left hand. Mariachi grimaces,  crumbling to the floor. He keeps a tight grip on his hand When he opens his hand to see the damage, the camera can right through his hand for a reverse shot of his face thr the hole.
Now get the hell off my property and  take your hand with you!!!

Moco is laughing and looking at his men for support, but one else laughs. Mariachi tries to stand, but he falls ba When he rises again he has the gun in his hand. He shoots Moco in the chest. Moco falls back and hits the ground ha He gasps for air... Moco's men gather around him. Mean Dude #5 crouches down check Moco's throat pulse. Moco's dead. Mean Dude #5 stri a match across Moco's face and lights up a cigarette. He  turns and walks away. The others follow. Mariachi wraps a tourniquet on his arm, kisses Domino, op Azul's case, sees the weapons, and rides off with it.

He looks back at the town behind him, then places his han on the motorcycle to drive off. We notice the metal brace his hand. Mariachi rides into the sunset road. He speeds past a sig "ACU-A 18 miles" "Coming soon EL MARIACHI II"
